full_summary:
**Dune Crossing Boardwalk Repairs at Cavendish Beach and Brackley Beach Complexes, Prince Edward Island National Park**
### Title in English and French
The government of Canada, through Parks Canada, is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for a Prime General Contractor to repair the dune crossing boardwalks at the Cavendish Beach and Brackley Beach Complexes, located within the Prince Edward Island National Park, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts, Quebec. This project involves repairing the Cavendish & Brackley Beach Dune Crossings stairs and accessible ramps to ensure they remain structurally sound and safe for visitors.

### Solicitation Details
* Reference number: PW-23-01031109
* Solicitation number: 5P468-22-0280/A
* Publication date: 2023-03-30
* Tender closing date: 2023-04-06T13:00
* Contracting entity: Parks Canada
* Regions of opportunity: Canada
* Regions of delivery: Prince Edward Island

### Project Overview
The project involves repairing four dune crossing sections at the Cavendish and Brackley Beach Complexes, including:
* Repairing existing steel frames and helical piles at the Cavendish Beach lower ramp section
* Designing, supplying, and installing helical piles and connection requirements at ramp locations
* Supplying and installing new steel pile saddles, connection brackets, spindles, and handrail components
* Replacing ramp and landing sections
* Realigning the lower ramp sections and intermediate landing
* Reconstructing the lower stairs rail system
* Removing and disposing of existing timber components that cannot be salvaged
* Rehabilitating disturbed areas to the satisfaction of the Departmental Representative
* Cleaning up debris and construction waste for disposal offsite.

Bidders must demonstrate their ability to complete the project according to the specifications and drawings, as well as their experience in construction projects involving similar scope and complexity.

### Contract Requirements
The Prime General Contractor will be responsible for all materials, labour, equipment, and ancillaries necessary for the completion of the work as indicated on the drawings and as described in the specifications and notes.

Bidders must submit their proposals as per the RFP documents, which can be obtained from [insert website or contact information].

### Important Dates
* Tender closing date: 2023-04-06T13:00
* Expected contract start date: To be determined
* Expected
